meanings.sent1: I had to retranslate the document to make sure it was accurate.
meanings.sent2: She decided to retranslate the book to share it with a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: After the machine made a mistake, I had to retranslate the text for the third time.
meanings.sent4: The song lyrics lost their meaning in translation, so I had to retranslate them carefully.
meanings.sent5: I will retranslate the message to ensure everyone understands it clearly.

meanings.sent1: The software can retranslate the text into multiple languages.
meanings.sent2: He needed to retranslate the speech into Spanish for the international audience.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally retranslated the phrase into a language no one understands!
meanings.sent4: Her words were retranslated into a beautiful poem by the translator.
meanings.sent5: The ancient text was retranslated into modern English for better comprehension.

meanings.definition: To translate back into the original language.
meanings.sent1: The professor had to retranslate the ancient manuscript into Latin.
meanings.sent2: They decided to retranslate the document into English for clarity.
meanings.sent3: I playfully retranslated the joke into its original language for fun.
meanings.sent4: The poem was retranslated into its native tongue to preserve its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The book was retranslated into French to honor the author's roots.
